Simple, how low can YOU go? The apogee can be as high as you want, just make the perogee as low as you can (without clipping mountains).

You must post a picture of the map view, with your mouse on the Pe sign and a screenshot not in map view around where your perogee is.

F1 takes screenshots.

Here\'s mine:

Lowest is 573 m!
I got one to 546 m, but i didn\'t think to screenshot it. Then I tried for lower, got it to 237 m, and promptly hit a mountain.
I got to 331 meters back in 0.13 but I think I deleted that screeny. Never did hit a mountain though

i guess its a bug.. there are tousands of meters difference but the terrain still doesnt look like it.. even around craters, or the canyon leading to the biggest crater is really deep.. i bet something went wrong when they generated the moon

The texture is bland enough that you don\'t really notice any height differences without the light being nearly 90 degrees offset.
Unless you orbit equator of the Mun or close to it your not safe with those low orbits. The Mun will rotate underneath you so where you orbit on the Mun will change.
Before the update, I think I went as low as 300, but after update (at least at the southern pole) ridges go as high as 3 000 meters, not allowing me to get that low.
